questions.question: Which proteins will be included in H-zone of myofilaments if sarcomere is in relaxed state?
questions.options: Myosin and actin Tropomyosin, actin and troponin Myosin Actin

questions.question: Globular regulatory protein of skeletal muscle fibres is:
questions.options: Tropomyosin Myosin Actin Troponin

questions.question: Sliding filament model of muscle contraction suggests that, the polymerised molecules that move to shorten a muscle are those of:
questions.options: Troponin Collagen Actin Myosin

questions.question: The regulatory protein of skeletal muscles whose filaments run close to the F-actin throughout its length is:
questions.options: Troponin T Troponin C Titin Tropomyosin

questions.question: An active ATPase activity and binding site for ATP and actin filaments are found on:
questions.options: Light meromyosin Short tail of heavy meromyosin Globular head of heavy meromyosin Long tail of the meromyosin monomer

questions.question: The flat bone of axial skeleton lying on the ventral midline of thorax is:
questions.options: Ribs Sternum Clavicle Hyoid

questions.question: Which one of the following is the correct description of the given part of human skeleton?
questions.options: The 9th and 10th pairs of ribs are called vertebrosternal ribs First vertebra is atlas which articulates with the occipital condyles Each pectoral girdle comprises one clavicle and one scapula The number of sacral vertebrae is five in both adults and foetus
questions.answer: First vertebra is atlas which articulates with the occipital condyles

questions.question: A single, U-shaped bone present at the base of the buccal cavity is:
questions.options: Hyoid Mandible Sphenoid Occipital

questions.question: Number of lumbar vertebrae in human skeleton is:
Which one is mismatched?
questions.options: Sternum and ribs : Axial skeleton Humerus and pectoral girdle : Appendicular skeleton Malleus, incus, stapes : Ear ossicles A single U-shaped bone called hyoid is present at the base of buccal cavity : Appendicular skeleton
questions.answer: A single U-shaped bone called hyoid is present at the base of buccal cavity : Appendicular skeleton

questions.question: 'I' am primarily involved in locomotory actions and changes of body postures. 'I' have striped muscle fibres when observed through the microscope and my activities are under the voluntary control of the nervous system. Who am 'I'?
questions.options: Cardiac muscles Biceps Iris Visceral muscles

questions.question: Visceral muscles are also known as:
questions.options: Voluntary striated muscles Voluntary non-striated muscles Involuntary non-striated muscles Involuntary striated muscles

questions.question: Least blood supply will be present in case of:
questions.options: Skeletal muscles Smooth muscle Cardiac muscle Striated muscles

questions.question: Which one of the following statements is incorrect?
questions.options: Heart muscles are striated and involuntary The muscles of hands and legs are striated and voluntary The muscles located in the inner walls of alimentary canal are striated and involuntary Muscles located in the reproductive tracts are unstriated and involuntary
questions.answer: The muscles located in the inner walls of alimentary canal are striated and involuntary

questions.question: Muscles with characteristic striations and involuntary are:
questions.options: Muscles in the wall of alimentary canal Muscles of the heart Muscles assisting locomotion Muscles of the eyelids

questions.question: Select the activity which would essentially involve movement but not result in locomotion?
questions.options: Walking Climbing Talking Swimming

questions.question: Locomotory structures in macrophages found in tissues, are:
questions.options: Flagella Cilia Stereocilia Pseudopodia

questions.question: Cytoplasmic streaming, a characteristic of amoeba and white blood cells of vertebrates is caused by:
questions.options: Sliding microtubules Elongating cell walls Contracting microfilaments Relaxing microtubules

questions.question: Macrophages and leucocytes exhibit:
questions.options: Ciliary movement Flagellar movement Amoeboid movement Gliding movement

questions.question: Which type of joint is seen between carpals?
questions.options: Saddle joint Gliding joint Ball & socket joint Pivot joint

questions.question: Type of joint where flat skull bones fuse end to end with the help of dense fibrous connective tissue is called:
questions.options: Synovial joint Cartilaginous joint Gliding joint Fibrous joint

questions.question: Knee joint and elbow joint are examples of:
questions.options: Pivot joint Gliding joint Saddle joint Hinge joint

questions.question: Among the following, limited movement is permitted by joint present at/between:
questions.options: Adjacent vertebrae Junction of carpal and metacarpal of thumb Atlanto-occipital joint Femur and acetabulum

questions.question: Intervertebral discs are the joints between bodies of adjacent vertebrae. This is an example of:
questions.options: Cartilaginous joint Fibrous joint Saddle joint Gliding joint

questions.question: Property common to muscular and neural tissues is:
questions.options: Elasticity Extensibility Contractility Excitability

questions.question: Dimensions of which of the following remains unaffected when skeletal muscle fibres are in maximally contracted state?
questions.options: Region between two Z lines Anisotropic band Isotropic band 'H' zone

questions.question: Red muscle fibres differ from white muscles fibres as:
questions.options: Former contains large quantities of oxygen binding pigment haemoglobin Latter has larger amount of sarcoplasmic reticulum than former Former are unbranched and multinucleated while latter are not Latter are responsible for aerobic respiration while former undergo only anaerobic respiration
questions.answer: Latter has larger amount of sarcoplasmic reticulum than former

questions.question: The central part of thick filament, not overlapped by thin filaments when a muscle is in relaxed state is called:
questions.options: A-zone I-zone H-zone O-zone

questions.question: The portion of the myofibril between two successive 'Z' lines is called:
questions.options: Sarcoplasm Sarcolemma Sarcomere Sarcosome

questions.question: Which of the following is not an auto immune disorder?
questions.options: Simple gout Rheumatoid arthritis Myasthenia gravis Multiple sclerosis

questions.question: Progressive degeneration of skeletal muscle mostly due to genetic disorder is:
questions.options: Muscular dystrophy Tetany Gout Arthritis

questions.question: Decreased level of estrogen in the females after menopause is implicated as a common causative factor of:
questions.options: Osteoarthritis Osteoporosis Rheumatoid arthritis Muscular dystrophy

questions.question: Rapid spasms (wild contractions) in muscle due to low Ca⁺⁺ in body fluid:
questions.options: Myasthenia gravis Muscular dystrophy Tetany Arthritis

questions.question: Which of the following muscle disorder occurs due to formation of defective antibodies?
questions.options: Osteoarthritis Myasthenia gravis Muscular dystrophy Hypertrophy

questions.question: Ions essential for muscles contraction are stored in:
questions.options: Sarcoplasm Sarcoplasmic reticulum Spherosomes Sarcosomes

questions.question: The neurotransmitter usually released between a motor neuron and muscle cell is:
questions.options: Serotonin Dopamine GABA Acetylcholine

questions.question: Which of the following statement is not true regarding A-band?
questions.options: Middle part contains M-line Length remains constant during the muscle contraction Includes H-zone and M-line Has thick filaments only

questions.question: Identify the trimeric protein which masks the active sites for myosin on acting filaments:
questions.options: Tropomyosin Troponin Meromyosin G-Actin

questions.question: In a striated muscle fibre, Ca²⁺ is stored in:
questions.options: Golgi body Nucleus Cisternae of sarcoplasmic reticulum Myosin head

questions.question: Tongue bone is:
questions.options: Mandible Hyoid Flat bone Coccyx

questions.question: Which of the following is incorrect match regarding the bones and their number in humans?
questions.options: False ribs - The 8th, 9th and 10th pair of ribs Vertebrochondral ribs - 11th and 12th pair of ribs Carpals - Eight in each wrist True ribs - First seven pairs of ribs
questions.answer: Vertebrochondral ribs - 11th and 12th pair of ribs

questions.question: Bone not a part of appendicular skeleton, is:
questions.options: Sphenoid Scapula Patella Pubis

questions.question: Choose the incorrect match:
questions.options: Malleus, Incus, Stapes – Ear ossicles Lacrimal bone, Nasal bone, Maxilla – Paired bones Humerus, Radius, Ulna – Bones of forelimb Muscular dystrophy – Disorder of skeletal system
questions.answer: Muscular dystrophy – Disorder of skeletal system

questions.question: A slightly elevated ridge called 'spine' which terminates as a flat 'acromian process' is present on:
questions.options: Ventral surface of scapula Dorsal surface of scapula Lateral surface of pubis Centrum of thoracic vertebrae

questions.question: Which of the following is not applicable to red muscle fibres when compared to white muscle fibres?
questions.options: Sustained contraction for long periods Rich in myoglobin Faster in contraction rate Rich in mitochondria

questions.question: During the event of muscle contraction which event does not occur?
questions.options: Cross bridges are formed ATP undergoes hydrolysis Ca²⁺ ions are released from SR Thick filaments slide inward towards the M-line
questions.answer: Thick filaments slide inward towards the M-line

questions.question: In which of the following functions, white muscles are not used?
questions.options: Moving eye balls Fast and strenuous work for short duration For sustained work at a slow rate for prolonged duration Fast flight in sparrows
questions.answer: For sustained work at a slow rate for prolonged duration

questions.question: Which of the following muscles are not under the voluntary control of nervous system?
questions.options: Pharynx Wall of urinary bladder Anterior end of oesophagus Tongue

questions.question: In a contracted skeletal muscle fibre:
questions.options: M line disappears H–zone elongates I-band remains constant A–band disappears

questions.question: Read the following statements and choose the correct option:
questions.options: There are 12 pairs of thoracic vertebrae in man White muscle fibres contain a higher amount of oxygen storing protein than red muscles fibres A muscle twitch is a single action potential causing brief contraction and then relaxation Sternum is present on the dorsal side of the body in humans
questions.answer: A muscle twitch is a single action potential causing brief contraction and then relaxation

questions.question: Which pair of ribs do not articulate directly with the sternum but attach with hyaline cartilage of other rib?
questions.options: 6th, 7th and 8th 7th, 8th and 9th 8th, 9th and 10th 10th, 11th and 21th

questions.question: Which of the following statements is an incorrect description?
questions.options: Our skull is dicondylic, because the skull region articulates with the superior region of the vertebral column with the help of two occipital condyles The pituitary gland is located in the bony cavity of the sphenoid bone called sella tursica The first vertebra is axis and it articulates with occipital condyles 11th and 12th pairs of ribs are called floating ribs
questions.answer: The first vertebra is axis and it articulates with occipital condyles

questions.question: Each arm of human is made of:
questions.options: 30 bones 20 bones 60 bones 15 bones

questions.question: Which of the following is not an example of synovial joint?
questions.options: Joint between humerus and pectoral girdle Joint between atlas and axis Joint between adjacent vertebrae Knee joint

questions.question: Which one of the following ions is essential for muscular contraction?
questions.options: Na⁺, Ca⁺⁺ Mg⁺⁺, Ca⁺⁺ Mg⁺⁺, K⁺ K⁺, Na⁺

questions.question: Which of the following are the regulatory proteins in the muscle contraction?
questions.options: Troponin and tropomyosin Troponin and actin Myosin and tropomyosin Actin and tropomyosin

questions.question: During muscle contraction which of the following does not occur?
questions.options: No change in length of anisotropic band Decrease in length of isotropic band No change in length of A band Decrease in length of action myofilaments
questions.answer: Decrease in length of action myofilaments

questions.question: What would happen if ATP suddenly were not available after the sarcomere had started to shorten?
questions.options: Cross bridges would not be able to detach from actin Muscle would remain in a state of rigidity Muscle would relax immediately Both (a) & (b)

questions.question: Myasthenia gravis involves weakness of skeletal muscles. Which of the following can act as a primary treatment of it?
questions.options: Injection of neurotransmitter acetylcholine Injection of neurotransmitter adrenaline Injection of acetylcholinesterase inhibitor Taking protein rich diet

questions.question: Which of the following component is a part of the pectoral girdle?
questions.options: Sternum Acetabulum Glenoid cavity Ilium

questions.question: The joint between carpal and metacarpal of thumb in man is:
questions.options: Ellipsoid Saddle Hinge Pivot

questions.question: Progressive degeneration of skeletal muscles due to genetic disorder is:
questions.options: Myasthenia gravis Muscular dystrophy Tetany Gout

questions.question: Select the odd one w.r.t. girdle bones:
questions.options: Clavicle Ischium Ileum Pubis

questions.question: Which of the following ribs are not connected ventrally with the sternum and are called as floating ribs?
questions.options: First five pairs 8th, 9th and 10th pairs 11th and 12th pair 7th, 8th and 9th pairs

questions.question: Lower jaw is made up of:
questions.options: Mandible Vomer Maxilla Palatine

questions.question: An acromion process is characteristically found in the:
questions.options: Pelvic girdle of mammals Skull of frog Pectoral girdle of mammals Sperm of mammals

questions.question: Which of the following pairs is correctly matched?
questions.options: Cartilaginous joint - Skull bones Hinge joint - Between vertebrae Fibrous joint - Between phalanges Gliding joint - Between zygapophyses of the successive vertebrae
questions.answer: Gliding joint - Between zygapophyses of the successive vertebrae

questions.question: The clavicle articulates with _____ of scapula:
questions.options: Acromion process Glenoid cavity Acetabulum cavity Ball and socket joint

questions.question: Sternum is connected to ribs by:
questions.options: Bony matter White fibrous cartilage Hyaline cartilage Areolar tissue

questions.question: Bone formed by the ossification of tendon is called:
questions.options: Sesamoid bone Cartilage bone Investing bone Replacing bone

questions.question: The joint between atlas and axis is called:
questions.options: Angular joint Hinge joint Pivot joint Saddle joint

questions.question: Formation of abnormal granules called pannus are secreted by synovial membrane in case of:
questions.options: Osteoarthritis Rheumatoid arthritis Gout Osteomyelitis

questions.question: A motor neuron along with the muscle fibres connected to it, constitute:
questions.options: Neuromuscular junction Motor unit Single unit muscle fibre Multi unit muscle fibre

questions.question: Myasthenia gravis is autoimmune disorder in which (A) tire easily and is caused by binding of antibodies to (B).
questions.options: A–Smooth muscle, B– Nicotine receptors A–Skeletal muscle, B–Acetylcholine receptors A–Cardiac muscle, B–Adrenaline receptors A–Skeletal muscle, B– Noradrenaline

questions.question: Foramen magnum is associated with which bone?
questions.options: Frontal Parietal Temporal Occipital

questions.question: Number of anterior curves present with human vertebral column is:
The heaviest and largest vertebrae in humans are:
questions.options: Thoracic Lumbar Cervical Sacral

questions.question: Phalangeal formula for the hand of a human is:
Ribs are attached to:
questions.options: Scapula Sternum Clavicle Ilium

questions.question: If a muscle fibre contracts, which of the following will not occur?
questions.options: A–bands retain the length Z–lines move close together Change in size of I–band Length of actin filament increases

questions.question: Which of the following bones is/are not paired?
questions.options: Maxilla Nasal Vomer Palatine

questions.question: Knee cap is formed of a triangular bone patella, which is modified:
questions.options: Cartilage Skin Tendon Ligament

questions.question: Dermal, S-shaped bone with 2 curvatures, one of which interacts with sternum is:
questions.options: Pelvic girdle of mammals Skull of frog Clavicle Scapula

questions.question: Select the true statement:
questions.options: A band is present in the middle of sarcomere H zone is present in the middle of A–band M line is present in the middle of H–zone All of these

questions.question: What is the type of movable joint present between the atlas and axis?
questions.options: Pivot Saddle Hinge Gliding

questions.question: ATPase of the muscle is located in:
questions.options: Actinin Troponin Myosin Actin

questions.question: Intervertebral disc is found in the vertebral column of:
questions.options: Birds Reptiles Mammals Amphibians

questions.question: Which one of the following is showing the correct sequential order of vertebrae in the vertebral column of human beings?
questions.options: Cervical–lumbar–thoracic–sacral–coccygeal Cervical–thoracic–sacral–lumbar–coccygeal Cervical–sacral–thoracic–lumbar–coccygeal Cervical–thoracic–lumbar–sacral–coccygeal

questions.question: Which one of the following pairs is incorrect?
questions.options: Hinge joint: between humerus and pectoral girdle Pivot joint: between atlas and axis Gliding joint: between the carpals Saddle joint: between carpals and metacarpals of thumb
questions.answer: Hinge joint: between humerus and pectoral girdle

questions.question: Which one of the following is not a disorder of bone?
questions.options: Arthritis Osteoporosis Rickets Atherosclerosis

questions.question: Which one is not the character of red skeletal muscle fibres?
questions.options: Smaller diameter More mitochondria More sarcoplasmic reticulum More blood capillaries

questions.question: Least blood supply will be present in case of:
questions.options: Skeletal muscles Smooth muscle Cardiac muscle Striated muscles

questions.question: Knee joint and elbow joint are examples of:
questions.options: Saddle joint Ball and socket joint Pivot joint Hinge joint

questions.question: Which one of the following statements is incorrect?
questions.options: Heart muscles are striated and involuntary The muscles of hands and legs are striated and voluntary The muscles located in the inner walls of alimentary canal are striated and involuntary Muscles located in the reproductive tracts are unstriated and involuntary
questions.answer: The muscles located in the inner walls of alimentary canal are striated and involuntary

questions.question: Which one of the following statements is true?
questions.options: Head of humerus bone articulates with acetabulum of pectoral girdle Head of humerus bone articulates with the glenoid cavity of pectoral girdle Head of humerus bone articulates with acetabulum of pelvic girdle Head of humerus bone articulates with a glenoid cavity of pelvic girdle
questions.answer: Head of humerus bone articulates with the glenoid cavity of pectoral girdle

questions.question: Muscles with characteristic striations and involuntary are:
questions.options: Muscles in the wall of alimentary canal Muscles of the heart Muscles assisting locomotion Muscles of the eyelids
